description: Set up Auth0 for authentication and identity management. Get your domain, client ID, and client secret for integrating Auth0 into your application.

outputs.description: Application Client Secret for server-side usage

steps.message: We'll get your Auth0 domain, Client ID, and Client Secret. You'll need an Auth0 application â€” we'll create one if you don't have one already.
Opening the Auth0 dashboard. Sign in if prompted.
Do you have an Auth0 application already?

choices.label: No, I need to create one

steps.message: Go to 'Applications' > 'Applications' in the sidebar, then click 'Create Application'. Give it a name and select the application type that matches your project (e.g. 'Regular Web Application', 'Single Page Application', or 'Native').
Go to 'Applications' > 'Applications' in the sidebar and click on your application to open its settings.
Copy the 'Domain' value and paste it here (e.g., your-tenant.auth0.com):
steps.validation_error: That doesn't look like a valid Auth0 domain. It should be like 'your-tenant.auth0.com'.

steps.message: Copy the 'Client ID' and paste it here:
steps.validation_error: That doesn't look like a valid Auth0 Client ID. It should be a 32-character alphanumeric string.

steps.message: Copy the 'Client Secret' and paste it here:
steps.validation_error: That doesn't look like a valid Auth0 Client Secret. It should be 32-64 characters (alphanumeric, hyphens, underscores).

steps.message: Setup complete. Automated validation is skipped because Auth0's client credentials flow requires an 'audience' parameter specific to your API. Test by initiating a login flow in your application.

gotchas: The Client Secret must NEVER be exposed in client-side code. Use it only on the server side.
Auth0's free plan includes up to 25,000 monthly active users and unlimited social connections.
Make sure to configure your 'Allowed Callback URLs', 'Allowed Logout URLs', and 'Allowed Web Origins' in the application settings.
Auth0 domains can be regional (e.g., your-tenant.us.auth0.com). Use the exact domain shown in your dashboard.
Automated validation is not performed because Auth0's client credentials flow requires an 'audience' parameter. Verify by testing a login flow.
